📢 𝘾𝙤𝙢𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙨𝙤𝙤𝙣! Marion City Schools and the Mid-Ohio Food Collective will be holding FREE PRODUCE MARKETS for income-eligible families starting Wednesday, September 23. View the flier for scheduled dates and times. The markets will be located at the 📍 Marion County Fairgrounds main entrance parking lot at 220 E. Fairground St. and are 🚗 drive-thru only.

🍊🥬 Produce is available while supplies last, and an ID is required. There is a limit of two family pick-ups per adult. #WeRPrexies

post_text:
💻 𝐂𝐇𝐑𝐎𝐌𝐄𝐁𝐎𝐎𝐊 𝐔𝐏𝐃𝐀𝐓𝐄! The district is working with Dell on securing the last of the Chromebooks for students, which are currently on backorder due to the high demand as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience that this has caused. The distributor has communicated to us that we should expect to receive them next week. We will communicate the distribution process with you as soon as the Chromebooks are delivered to us.

Please know that any student that is still waiting for a device will 𝐧𝐨𝐭 be held responsible for any missed work during this time. If you have any questions, please contact your student’(s) front office directly. Thank you for your patience and understanding. #WeRPrexies

🥪🍎🥛 A letter is coming home to families of students participating in the 𝐎𝐧𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐞 𝐋𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐏𝐫𝐨𝐠𝐫𝐚𝐦 to opt for meal service. However, that will not take place until we receive your permission slip. To support your remote student(s) this week, see below:

post_text:
👋 Welcome back, MCS Presidents! Today begins an exciting week where we welcome students back to school. Our staff has been busy preparing, so make no mistake, this school year will be great!

📸 As a reminder, we invite students AND staff to share back-to-school photos with us THROUGHOUT this week! Before you hop on the bus, begin your lectures, or crack open a chromebook, snap a picture and share it with us on social media by using #WeRPrexies in your public post. We are all in this together; let’s do this!

post_text: ⏳ We are only ② days away from the beginning of another school year! Whether you will be attending school in the classroom or at home, we want to see YOU! 🤳 Students AND staff are invited to click away and share pictures using #𝐖𝐞𝐑𝐏𝐫𝐞𝐱𝐢𝐞𝐬 on 👍 Facebook, 📸 Instagram or 🐦 Twitter. If your post is 𝐩𝐮𝐛𝐥𝐢𝐜, we will be able to share it on our social media pages too. Help us to create an awesome photo collage for what is sure to be the start of a memorable year!

✅ This post is for students assigned to 𝐆𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐩 𝐂 in the Hybrid Learning Model! Starting 𝐌𝐨𝐧𝐝𝐚𝐲, 𝐀𝐮𝐠𝐮𝐬𝐭 𝟑𝟏, students in 𝐆𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐩 𝐂 will attend face-to-face classes in school ALL four days next week, which includes: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday.

❗Parents/Guardians, if you have multiple children in your household who attend school in our district and have not yet been notified of which student(s) are in Group C, please contact your child’s school directly. We look forward to welcoming our students back! 👋 #WeRPrexies

We are excited to see our student-athletes back in action and together, and it is up to all of us to make sure it stays that way. Typically, we would like to have as many fans in attendance as possible to support our athletes, cheerleaders and band members, however the governor’s guidance limits our allowable capacity at all athletic event locations.

As a reminder, spectator attendance is capped at 15% of venue capacity for both home and away fans, and families of the participants from both teams are the first priority for seating at athletic events. All tickets will be presale. There will be no tickets sold at events.

The order prohibits temporary seating of any kind (such as additional…

⏰ 𝐒𝐢𝐱𝐭𝐡 𝐠𝐫𝐚𝐝𝐞: 1:30 p.m. - 2:00 p.m.

👩‍💻👨‍💻 Harding High School will be hosting a virtual discussion through Google Meet to help incoming freshmen make the adjustment to high school during this extraordinary time.

🗓️ Two discussion sessions will be available: 𝐓𝐡𝐮𝐫𝐬𝐝𝐚𝐲, 𝐀𝐮𝐠𝐮𝐬𝐭 𝟐𝟎 𝐟𝐫𝐨𝐦 𝟏:𝟎𝟎 𝐩.𝐦. - 𝟐:𝟎𝟎 𝐩.𝐦. AND 𝐅𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐚𝐲, 𝐀𝐮𝐠𝐮𝐬𝐭 𝟐𝟏 𝐟𝐫𝐨𝐦 𝟏𝟏:𝟎𝟎 𝐚.𝐦. - 𝟏𝟐:𝟎𝟎 𝐩.𝐦.
📧 To join, use the Google Meet invitation sent to your school email address.

🗓️ 𝐑𝐄𝐌𝐈𝐍𝐃𝐄𝐑! Conditioning for 𝐆𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐭 𝐌𝐢𝐝𝐝𝐥𝐞 𝐒𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥 fall sports takes place this week and next! Mark the following dates and times on your calendar:

🏐 𝐕𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐲𝐛𝐚𝐥𝐥 - July 23-24 and July 30-31 from 8:00 a.m. - 10:00 a.m. in the Grant Middle School gym.
🏃 𝐂𝐫𝐨𝐬𝐬 𝐂𝐨𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐫𝐲 - July 24, 27-28, and 30 starting at 9:00 a.m. on the Grant Middle School gym steps.
⚽ 𝐒𝐨𝐜𝐜𝐞𝐫 - July 27, and 29 from 9:00 a.m. - 10:30 a.m. at the Grant Middle School soccer field on the corner of Brightwood and Presidential Dr.
📣 𝐂𝐡𝐞𝐞𝐫𝐥𝐞𝐚𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 - Tryouts will be July 29-30 from 8:00 a.m. - 10:00 a.m. in the Grant Middle School small gym. Contact 𝐌𝐨𝐫𝐠𝐚𝐧 𝐂𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐬 at ➡️ 𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐠𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐬𝟑𝟗𝟗𝟗@𝐲𝐚𝐡𝐨𝐨.𝐜𝐨𝐦 or 𝐌𝐚𝐧𝐝𝐲 𝐀𝐝𝐚𝐦𝐬 at ➡️ 𝐚𝐚𝐝𝐚𝐦𝐬@𝐦𝐜𝐬𝐩𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐢𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬.𝐨𝐫𝐠 for more information.

post_text:
Since we are starting the school year unlike any other, we have made changes to the school calendar to allow for more professional development, more preparation and more training for staff.

🗓️ The 𝐍𝐄𝐖 start date for 𝐩𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥, 𝐤𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐫𝐠𝐚𝐫𝐭𝐞𝐧, 𝐬𝐢𝐱𝐭𝐡 and 𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐡 𝐠𝐫𝐚𝐝𝐞 is 𝐌𝐨𝐧𝐝𝐚𝐲, 𝐀𝐮𝐠𝐮𝐬𝐭 𝟐𝟒.
🗓️ The 𝐍𝐄𝐖 start date for 𝐫𝐞𝐦𝐚𝐢𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐠𝐫𝐚𝐝𝐞𝐬 is 𝐓𝐮𝐞𝐬𝐝𝐚𝐲, 𝐀𝐮𝐠𝐮𝐬𝐭 𝟐𝟓.

#WeRPrexies

𝐆𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐭 𝐌𝐢𝐝𝐝𝐥𝐞 𝐒𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥 is excited to announce conditioning start dates for the following sports:

🏐 𝐕𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐲𝐛𝐚𝐥𝐥 - July 24-25 and July 30-31 from 8:00 a.m. - 10:00 a.m. in the Grant Middle School gym.
🏃 𝐂𝐫𝐨𝐬𝐬 𝐂𝐨𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐫𝐲 - July 21-22, 24, 27-28, and 30 starting at 9:00 a.m. on the Grant Middle School gym steps.
⚽ 𝐒𝐨𝐜𝐜𝐞𝐫 - July 20, 22, 27, and 29 from 9:00 a.m. - 10:30 a.m. at the Grant Middle School soccer field on the corner of Brightwood and Presidential Dr.
🏈 𝐅𝐨𝐨𝐭𝐛𝐚𝐥𝐥 - July 20-22 from 3:00 p.m. - 5:00 p.m. at the Grant Middle School stadium.
📣 𝐂𝐡𝐞𝐞𝐫𝐥𝐞𝐚𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 -- Tryouts will be July 29-30 from 8:00 a.m. - 10:00 a.m. in the Grant Middle School small gym.

Athletes need to bring their own water, and be aware that locker room facilities will not be available for the first two weeks.

Questions? Contact Mike Lindsey, Grant Middle School Athletic Director, at 740-223-4857 or via email ➡️ mlindsey@mcspresidents.org. #WeRPrexies

While we are still working on the reopening plan specific to Marion City Schools, we would like to share with you the 𝐌𝐚𝐫𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐂𝐨𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐲 𝐒𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥𝐬 𝐑𝐞𝐨𝐩𝐞𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐀𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭. It can be found on our website at ➡️ https://tinyurl.com/yc9dvweh. The agreement consists of general principles that will guide each school district throughout Marion County as steps are taken to reopen schools for the 2020-2021 school year.

We are currently working hard to prepare Marion City Schools’ reopening plan and will share detailed information as soon as possible. Thank you for your patience and understanding. #WeRPrexies

post_text:
Today, Thursday, July 2, 2020, Governor DeWine announced back to school health and safety guidelines for all school districts across Ohio. Marion City Schools is currently reviewing those guidelines.

Our school district has been planning and preparing for multiple scenarios to safely welcome students and staff back.

We will be reviewing the latest information from the governor, so we can meet the requirements set forth in these guidelines. Once we know more, we will share more details. #WeRPrexies

Did you know? 🐅 June is National Zoo and Aquarium Month! 🦈

Launch into summer by having a zoo or aquarium come to you! 💻 Many offer online virtual tours or animal cams. 🐒 The Cincinnati Zoo holds a 𝑯𝒐𝒎𝒆 𝑺𝒂𝒇𝒂𝒓𝒊 𝑭𝒂𝒄𝒆𝒃𝒐𝒐𝒌 𝑳𝒊𝒗𝒆 event each Tuesday and Thursday at 3:00 p.m.. Tune in to see them highlight one animal and provide an activity you can do from home 👉 https://tinyurl.com/yc6x6dm5. If you miss the live event, the videos are posted to their webpage ➡️ https://tinyurl.com/yabk8ve2!

🦁 We want to know! What is your favorite animal to visit at the zoo or aquarium? Answer in the comments! #ZooAndAquariumMonth #WeRPrexies

👟🎾⚽⚾ We are excited to bring our athletes and coaches back together, and want to do so in the safest manner possible to ensure everyone’s wellbeing!

Marion City Schools has developed 𝗣𝗵𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝟭 of the 𝗔𝘁𝗵𝗹𝗲𝘁𝗶𝗰 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘁 𝗚𝘂𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀 using guidance from the Ohio Department of Health, the Ohio High School Athletic Association, the National Federation of High School Sports, and the Centers for Disease Control. Details outlining 𝗣𝗵𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝟭 can be found here 👉 https://tinyurl.com/yakarpy3.

If you have any questions, please contact 𝙈𝙖𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙣 𝘾𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙎𝙘𝙝𝙤𝙤𝙡𝙨 𝘼𝙩𝙝𝙡𝙚𝙩𝙞𝙘 𝘿𝙞𝙧𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙤𝙧, 𝙎𝙚𝙖𝙣 𝙆𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣𝙨 at skearns@mcspresidents.org. #WeRPrexies

post_text: 👏 Thank you, Johnnie Jackson, for continuing to work with the Marion community to inspire and support our youth! #WeRPrexies
shared_text:
Marion Ohio Rotary Club
May 26 at 1:47 PM ·

Today we had another great meeting (Via Zoom)! We heard from Johnnie Jackson, Diversity and Equity Supervisor at Marion City Schools who shared with Rotarians the importance of investing in our youth - particularly those of color. Johnnie pointed out that this is not only important as Marionites but as Rotarians.

post_text: 🕗 Fire up the time machine! First-grade students in Mrs. Issler’s class from Benjamin Harrison Elementary got to take a special trip back in time when creating timelines of their own lives for their last academic module. This project not only brought back fun memories, but also helped students see how changes occur over time. A successful project to end the school year! 👍 #WeRPrexies

text:

To view the entire graduation ceremony, visit ↪️ https://youtu.be/I9rS_wq62sk, and give a 📣 shout out to our super seniors! #WeRPrexies

text: 👨‍🎓👩‍🎓🎉 We’re getting ready to celebrate our seniors! Set-up for the drive-through commencement is in full swing! #WeRPrexies #PrexyProud

post_text:
👏 𝐂𝐎𝐍𝐆𝐑𝐀𝐓𝐔𝐋𝐀𝐓𝐈𝐎𝐍𝐒 𝐌𝐚𝐫𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐂𝐢𝐭𝐲 𝐒𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥𝐬 𝐂𝐥𝐚𝐬𝐬 𝐨𝐟 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟎! 🎓 𝐘𝐎𝐔 𝐃𝐈𝐃 𝐈𝐓! Today is the day that marks the completion of thirteen years of schooling, and now it’s time to celebrate! 🎉 The drive-through commencement ceremony will be held 𝐭𝐨𝐝𝐚𝐲, 𝐒𝐮𝐧𝐝𝐚𝐲, 𝐌𝐚𝐲 𝟏𝟕 from 𝟐:𝟎𝟎 𝐩.𝐦. - 𝟓:𝟎𝟎 𝐩.𝐦. The festivities will be aired LIVE on 1490 WMRN-AM radio station, and will be live-streamed on YouTube at ↪️ https://tinyurl.com/y9utmrgr.

Even though this school year presented many unique challenges, our seniors rose to the occasion, and proved the 𝒕𝒂𝒔𝒔𝒆𝒍 𝒘𝒂𝒔 𝒘𝒐𝒓𝒕𝒉 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒉𝒂𝒔𝒔𝒍𝒆. We applaud you, and wish you all the best as you go on to write your own stories. This class will go down in the history books! Continue to amaze us Class of 2020! You will be missed! #WeRPrexies #PrexyProud

post_text: ❤️ Words cannot express how grateful we are for our MCS students, staff, and families. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the second half of the school year has looked very different. The unexpected turn of events has not been easy, but our MCS family has risen to every challenge with 💪 resilience and understanding. We are here to support you; thank 𝐘𝐎𝐔 for supporting us! You are all 🌟 shining examples of why we are #PrexyProud! 🙌 #WeRPrexies

post_text:
🏫🎒 Over the next few weeks, belongings left in classrooms and lockers will be put into labeled, brown paper bags, and returned to their owners the week of May 26 - 29. Visit ➡️ https://tinyurl.com/yclvbuj4 for additional information. Details regarding the pick-up plan will be provided next week.

If you have questions or concerns, please contact your student’s 𝙝𝙤𝙢𝙚𝙧𝙤𝙤𝙢 𝙩𝙚𝙖𝙘𝙝𝙚𝙧 or 𝙘𝙡𝙖𝙨𝙨𝙧𝙤𝙤𝙢 𝙩𝙚𝙖𝙘𝙝𝙚𝙧. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we work to safely return your personal belongings. #WeRPrexies

post_text:
☺️ Have no fear; 𝓦𝓮𝓵𝓵𝓷𝓮𝓼𝓼 𝓦𝓮𝓭𝓷𝓮𝓼𝓭𝓪𝔂 is almost here! It’s important to take care of ourselves, stay refreshed, and reduce stress. We have a number of ideas to help exercise our minds and bodies during this extended time at home. Check them out at 👉 https://tinyurl.com/y8lfw33e.

➡️ For tomorrow, we challenge you to get outside and enjoy the ☀️ nice forecast by taking a bike ride 🚴 as a family or on your own. A bike ride is a great way to work your muscles and clear your head. Take a break and snap a picture 🤳 while you’re at it, and share it with us! Send an email to news@mcspresidents.org or tag us with #𝙋𝙧𝙚𝙭𝙮𝙋𝙧𝙤𝙪𝙙 in your social media post. We miss our MCS family, and would love to see how you are doing! #WeRPrexies

⭐ Today, it’s all about Jodi Boltz for our staff feature! Her ties to Marion City Schools are strong and the genuine care she has for her students is clear. Keep reading to find out what she has been focused on during this time of remote learning.

There have been many texts, emails, and phone calls between my classroom family. I look forward to Google Meets. 😊 Although we are providing instruction to our students, my main concern…

post_text:
Move over Flat Stanley! 𝑴𝒊𝒏𝒊 𝑴𝒊𝒔𝒔 𝑳 is taking over!

YMCA preschool teacher Annika Lieurance is encouraging her students to keep up their schooling by sending them miniature, motivational reminders in the form of herself! Her students have loved the idea! ❤️ They are taking Mini Miss L along on 🌈 outside adventures, and have her nearby when working on assignments.🖍️ The distance is no match for this teacher and her students! They are staying connected and inspired! #WeRPrexies #PrexyProud

🤩 Tracy Kessell is our staff feature for today! Keep reading to find out how she is navigating the world of remote learning, and the great effort she is putting forth to support her students and their education.

𝙍𝙤𝙡𝙚: First-Grade Teacher at Taft Elementary

𝙃𝙤𝙬 𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝙨𝙩𝙪𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙨 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙢𝙖𝙭𝙞𝙢𝙞𝙯𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙙𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙨𝙚 𝙪𝙣𝙥𝙧𝙚𝙘𝙚𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙚𝙙 𝙩𝙞𝙢𝙚𝙨? I am texting families through the Remind App, calling families, and Facetiming those that have that capability. I also upload YouTube read-alouds for my students, make videos of lesson material, and use Google Hangouts to meet with my students a couple times a week.

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙨𝙤𝙢𝙚𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙝𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣𝙚𝙙 𝙖𝙗𝙤𝙪𝙩 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧𝙨𝙚𝙡𝙛 𝙩𝙝𝙧𝙤𝙪𝙜𝙝 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙚𝙭𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙚𝙣𝙘𝙚? …

⚙️🏆 Did you know? Grant Middle School’s Robotics Team 2281N (Matthew Hutichinson, Josiah Payne, Dylan Willson, and Isaac Berry) and Team 2281Z (Richard Terry, Fabian Baltazar-Lopez, Damian Lines, and Zach Honaker) were selected from the world standings to compete in the simulated Fantasy Robotics Tournament!

The virtual event will be held tomorrow, April 25 at 12:30 p.m. and can be viewed at 👉 https://tinyurl.com/y7oja4aj. The simulation will use past match results to calculate virtual world results. How cool is that?!

Help us wish these students 𝑮𝑶𝑶𝑫 𝑳𝑼𝑪𝑲 and 𝑪𝒐𝒏𝒈𝒓𝒂𝒕𝒖𝒍𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏𝒔 on a successful season! #WeRPrexies

post_text:
We have received notice from Marion Public Health that the Friday Night Lights event involving turning on football stadium lights throughout Marion County violates the Stay at Home Order set forth by the Ohio Department of Health on April 2, 2020, and cannot be allowed to continue. Like you, we are deeply disappointed, and we were looking forward to the celebration. However, we understand that the safety of our fellow neighbors must come first. Our current situation in Marion - the increase in community cases being seen due to the outbreak of COVID19 in the prison and the vulnerability of our population to another outbreak - puts Marion County at increased risk right now. We must be vigilant and not create any unnecessary risks.

Although it will not happen as we all had hoped, we still plan to celebrate. We encourage all Marion County residents to still turn their porch lights on at 8:20 pm for 20 minutes tomorrow night to show support for the members of the Class of 2020. #WeRPrexies

❓Have you been running into problems when trying to access online school work, or struggling with remote learning in general? If so, the following are useful resources to help you navigate any roadblocks.

💻 The How-TO video walks users through logging into Google Chrome and accessing Schoology. (Shout out to Lauren Lothes, George Washington Elementary teacher, for putting the video together!)

📔 MCS Distance Learning Guide outlines ways to help make remote learning a success. Check it out! ➡️ https://tinyurl.com/yctghtmw

They have prepped, packed, and will be ready to distribute from 11:00 a.m. - 1:00 p.m. at the following locations: Harding High School, Grant Middle School, George Washington Elementary, Hayes Elementary, McKinley Elementary or Taft Elementary

post_text:
📣 What’s better than sharing your MCS Class of 2020 pride? … nothing, of course! Well, now you can update your Facebook profile picture with a Marion City Schools Class of 2020 frame and show your pride and support for our senior class!

If you already “like” our Facebook page, follow these VERY simple directions below! If you haven't “liked” our page, please do so and then follow these directions! We can’t wait to see all the frames on your profile pictures! ❤️🖤 #WeRPrexies #PrexieProud

💻 From your desktop:
▪️ Go to Facebook
▪️ Hover over your profile picture and click “Update”
▪️ Under Frames, click on the “Marion City Schools Class of 2020 frame” (you may need to click “See More” for it to show up
▪️ Drag your picture to reposition, if necessary
▪️ Click “Use as Profile Picture”

💻 From your phone:
▪️ Go to Facebook
▪️ Click on your profile picture
▪️ Click “Add frame”
▪️ Click “Marion City Schools Class of 2020 frame” (you may need to click “See More” for it to show up
▪️ Click “Edit, Frames or Make Temporary” if you chose to make other updates
▪️ Click “Save”

post_text:
👏 Join us in recognizing Crystal Durain today! Learn about the unique ways she is finding to stay connected with her students to ensure they know, without a doubt, that she is there for them!

𝙍𝙤𝙡𝙚: Intermediate Specialized Learning Center at Hayes Elementary

𝙃𝙤𝙬 𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝙨𝙩𝙪𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙨 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙢𝙖𝙭𝙞𝙢𝙞𝙯𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙙𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙨𝙚 𝙪𝙣𝙥𝙧𝙚𝙘𝙚𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙚𝙙 𝙩𝙞𝙢𝙚𝙨? I have ridden the 🚌 that is delivering lunches. 🥪🍊🥛 I have also done "drive-bys" of my kids' houses and sat in my car in the driveway while the students sit on their porch, so we can talk. I have 📞 called them and talked with them on the phone, and I am planning individual video instruction with each student 👩‍💻.

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙨𝙤𝙢𝙚𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜…

💡🏟️ In honor of the graduating class of 2020, Marion County school districts will be lighting up their stadiums for 20 minutes to recognize the class of 2020 on Friday, April 24 at 8:20 p.m.

While stadiums will remain closed, schools are joining together to show support 🙌 to the seniors and the unexpected challenges that have impacted their school year. Community members are invited to participate by turning on their porch lights at 8:20 p.m. this Friday. Join us in celebrating our seniors! #WeRPrexies #PrexieProud

post_text:
**** Special Update ****

Per Governor Mike DeWine’s announcement this afternoon, Ohio schools will continue with emergency remote learning for the remainder of the current academic year due to COVID-19.

We know there will be many questions as a result of this announcement; we are working quickly to address those, as well as identify alternative solutions for the impacts of this decision. In the meantime, we appreciate all of you for your ongoing support as we work through this together. #WeRPrexies #InThisTogetherOhio

📚🎉 It is #𝙉𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙖𝙡𝙇𝙞𝙗𝙧𝙖𝙧𝙮𝙒𝙚𝙚𝙠, and we are ready to celebrate! We are so grateful for our libraries and the librarians who work to create a special environment for our students that fosters a love of reading and learning.

During this unique time, there are still numerous ways to access fun and exciting educational tools digitally. Here are just a couple of resources recommended by Susan Tabbert, Librarian at Hayes Elementary. Be sure to check them out and thank your librarian today!

🤩 We’re back with our next staff feature, and today we set our focus 👀 on Austin King! Take a moment to learn how he is continuing his guiding role of helping students to achieve their educational goals.

post_text:
🌟 Michelle Fouts, come on down! You are the next MCS staff member to be featured in our spotlight! Read on to see how Michelle has adapted to virtual teaching from home while balancing family life.

𝙍𝙤𝙡𝙚: Sixth-grade Intervention Specialist at Grant Middle School

𝙃𝙤𝙬 𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝙨𝙩𝙪𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙨 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙢𝙖𝙭𝙞𝙢𝙞𝙯𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙙𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙨𝙚 𝙪𝙣𝙥𝙧𝙚𝙘𝙚𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙚𝙙 𝙩𝙞𝙢𝙚𝙨? 📧 Email, 💻 google hangout meetings, use of Schoology, and discussion journals 📖

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙨𝙤𝙢𝙚𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙝𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣𝙚𝙙 𝙖𝙗𝙤𝙪𝙩 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧𝙨𝙚𝙡𝙛 𝙩𝙝𝙧𝙤𝙪𝙜𝙝 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙚𝙭𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙚𝙣𝙘𝙚? Teaching is a whole lot harder when chasing around a toddler at the same time!

𝙄 𝙡𝙤𝙫𝙚 𝙈𝙖𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙣 𝘾𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙎𝙘𝙝𝙤𝙤𝙡𝙨 𝙗𝙚𝙘𝙖𝙪𝙨𝙚…they care about the well-being of all our students and staff!

🙌 Michelle, we 🅐🅟🅟🅡🅔🅒🅘🅐🅣🅔 you and all that you are doing to ensure your students stay engaged and motivated! Keep up the exceptional work! #WeRPrexies #PrexieProud

📢🎓 Class of 2020, while we are still determining plans for the end of the year and awaiting additional direction from our state government, we want you to be able to have your caps and gowns.

Cap and gown pick up will be held Wednesday, April 22! Items will be available to students who have previously placed their orders. All balances must be paid 𝗜𝗡 𝗙𝗨𝗟𝗟 before pick up by visiting orders.jostens.com or by calling customer service at 1-800-567-8367. 𝙉𝙊𝙏𝙀: Payment cannot be made at the time of delivery due to social distancing guidelines.

During pick up, please remain in your vehicles. A staff member will ask for your name, and your items will be brought to you. #WeRPrexies

🎉🙌 Don’t forget! Tomorrow, April 15 we are hosting our 𝑴𝑪𝑺 𝑺𝒐𝒄𝒊𝒂𝒍 𝑫𝒊𝒔𝑫𝒂𝒏𝒄𝒆 𝒁𝑶𝑶𝑴 𝑷𝒂𝒓𝒕𝒚 at 3:00 p.m.! MCS K - 12th-grade students are encouraged to join! To secure your virtual dance spot please sign up at ➡️ https://tinyurl.com/tsns945. 𝘼𝙘𝙘𝙚𝙥𝙩𝙖𝙣𝙘𝙚 𝙞𝙨 𝙡𝙞𝙢𝙞𝙩𝙚𝙙 𝙩𝙤 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙛𝙞𝙧𝙨𝙩 100 𝙚𝙢𝙖𝙞𝙡 𝙖𝙙𝙙𝙧𝙚𝙨𝙨𝙚𝙨.

𝐍𝐎𝐓𝐄: Households with multiple children enrolled in the district can submit 𝙊𝙉𝙀 form and include each student’s information within the responses. These students can then join via one shared device. 👩‍💻 Internet access and a webcam are needed to participate.

Join us and reconnect in a fun way while rocking out to a playlist provided by DJ Kathy Gibson, 👩‍🍳 head cook at Benjamin Harrison Elementary! Sign up today! #WeRPrexies #PrexieProud

🎶💻🥳 We understand how difficult it’s been to be away from classmates during this time of remote learning, and that’s why we want to invite you to a 🅢🅞🅒🅘🅐🅛 “🅓🅘🅢🅓🅐🅝🅒🅔” 🅩🅞🅞🅜 🅟🅐🅡🅣🅨! Music will be brought to you by our very own DJ Kathy Gibson, head cook at Benjamin Harrison Elementary. Here are the details:

🕒 Wednesday, April 15 at 3:00 p.m.
😊 MCS students in K - 12th-grade
📝 Sign up by completing the following google form ➡️ https://tinyurl.com/tsns945 to secure your spot. 𝘼𝙘𝙘𝙚𝙥𝙩𝙖𝙣𝙘𝙚 𝙞𝙨 𝙡𝙞𝙢𝙞𝙩𝙚𝙙 𝙩𝙤 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙛𝙞𝙧𝙨𝙩 100 𝙚𝙢𝙖𝙞𝙡 𝙖𝙙𝙙𝙧𝙚𝙨𝙨𝙚𝙨.
𝐍𝐎𝐓𝐄: Households with multiple children enrolled in the district can submit 𝙊𝙉𝙀 form and include each student’s information within the responses. These students can then participate via one shared device.
👩‍💻 Internet access and a device that has a webcam are needed to participate.

Participants will receive an invitation via email 30 minutes prior to the start of the event that will include the link to the DisDance Zoom Party. Reconnect with your friends and show school spirit via a virtual dance party! #WeRPrexies #PrexieProud
text:
🎶💻🥳 We understand how difficult it’s been to be away from classmates during this time of remote learning, and that’s why we want to invite you to a 🅢🅞🅒🅘🅐🅛 “🅓🅘🅢🅓🅐🅝🅒🅔” 🅩🅞🅞🅜 🅟🅐🅡🅣🅨! Music will be brought to you by our very own DJ Kathy Gibson, head cook at Benjamin Harrison Elementary. Here are the details:

🕒 Wednesday, April 15 at 3:00 p.m.
😊 MCS students in K - 12th-grade
📝 Sign up by completing the following google form ➡️ https://tinyurl.com/tsns945 to secure your spot. 𝘼𝙘𝙘𝙚𝙥𝙩𝙖𝙣𝙘𝙚 𝙞𝙨 𝙡𝙞𝙢𝙞𝙩𝙚𝙙 𝙩𝙤 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙛𝙞𝙧𝙨𝙩 100 𝙚𝙢𝙖𝙞𝙡 𝙖𝙙𝙙𝙧𝙚𝙨𝙨𝙚𝙨.
𝐍𝐎𝐓𝐄: Households with multiple children enrolled in the district can submit 𝙊𝙉𝙀 form and include each student’s information within the responses. These students can then participate via one shared device.
👩‍💻 Internet access and a device that has a webcam are needed to participate.

Participants will receive an invitation via email 30 minutes prior to the start of the event that will include the link to the DisDance Zoom Party. Reconnect with your friends and show school spirit via a virtual dance party! #WeRPrexies #PrexieProud

post_text:
What better way to start off this Monday than by showcasing our next MCS staff member?! 👋 Meet Stephanie Hopton!

𝙍𝙤𝙡𝙚: Head cook at George Washington Elementary 👩‍🍳

𝙃𝙤𝙬 𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝙨𝙩𝙪𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙨 𝙙𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙨𝙚 𝙪𝙣𝙥𝙧𝙚𝙘𝙚𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙚𝙙 𝙩𝙞𝙢𝙚𝙨? I am working to pack breakfasts and lunches for the students. 🥪🍊🥛🍪

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙨𝙤𝙢𝙚𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙝𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣𝙚𝙙 𝙖𝙗𝙤𝙪𝙩 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧𝙨𝙚𝙡𝙛 𝙩𝙝𝙧𝙤𝙪𝙜𝙝 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙚𝙭𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙚𝙣𝙘𝙚? My desire to make nutritious food available to children is why I come to work. They need us, and I will be here for them as long as I’m able.

𝙄 𝙡𝙤𝙫𝙚 𝙈𝙖𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙣 𝘾𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙎𝙘𝙝𝙤𝙤𝙡𝙨 𝙗𝙚𝙘𝙖𝙪𝙨𝙚…they always put the students first!

Your continued work to ensure that meals are being made available to our students during this time of uncertainty is GREATLY APPRECIATED! MCS is thankful to have you as part of our family! #WeRPrexies #PrexieProud

post_text:
*** Update Thursday, April 2, 2020 ***

Did you know? Our county ADAMH board continues to offer support for students in crisis in Marion county. Many students feel comfort in having regular interaction with school staff, and may now be struggling with the changes in their environment due to COVID-19.

Any parent/legal guardian of a student in Marion County is encouraged to call Marion Area Counseling Center (MACC) if their child is struggling or in crisis. Contact April Smith at (740) 387-5210 for additional information about an initial consultation, which could be at no cost to the family. The initial consultation can be completed by phone or at MACC. Don’t hesitate to reach out!

For additional updates on our website, follow ↪️ https://tinyurl.com/ss2enal. #WeRPrexies

post_text:
📣 Open enrollment for the 2020-2021 school year starts tomorrow, April 1. Applications will be accepted through Monday, June 1. Students who want to change school buildings or school districts must apply for open enrollment.

Marion City Schools offers two types of open enrollment:

‣ intra-district open enrollment - from one Marion City School building to another (click here to download an application - https://tinyurl.com/wzemw7y)

‣ inter-district open enrollment - from another school district into Marion City School District (click here to download an application - https://tinyurl.com/u7bepsb)

It is preferred that completed open enrollment applications be mailed to the Student Enrollment Center located at 100 Executive Dr., Marion, OH 43302, but families can also return applications to a lockbox at the Student Enrollment Center. #WeRPrexies

post_text:
***** Special Update *****

Per Governor Mike DeWine’s announcement this afternoon, Ohio schools will continue remote learning through May 1, 2020 in response to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. We want to take this opportunity to thank our entire staff for their hard work, and all of our families for their ongoing support. We will be releasing information this week regarding the emergency meal distribution program, and how MCS will continue to comply with the executive order to provide education during this time. We will get through this together! #InThisTogetherOhio #WeRPrexies #PrexieProud

*** Update Monday, March 23, 2020 ***

Please note, there will be no emergency meal distribution tomorrow, March 24. Due to the recent “stay at home” directive, a new distribution plan is in place for Wednesday, March 25. Meals will be available for PICK UP at Harding High School, Grant Middle School, George Washington Elementary, Hayes Elementary, McKinley Elementary and Taft Elementary. Collection times are from 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. Children will receive three breakfast meals and three lunch meals on Wednesday. Please try to exercise social distancing protocols as best as possible.

For tonight’s full update, visit our website at ↪️ https://tinyurl.com/yx58jzrg. #WeRPrexies

post_text:
*** Update Thursday, March 19, 2020 ***

‣ Today, the emergency meal program served multiple day meals to more than 1,850 students! As a reminder, there will be NO meal delivery tomorrow, March 20.
During March 23 - April 1, meals will be distributed on Mondays and Wednesdays only. A two day supply will be given on Monday and a three day supply will be given on Wednesday.

‣ Teachers are calling families to understand students’ accessibility to electronic devices such as computers and iPads. If you receive a call from a number you do not know or a blocked number, please answer the call, because it may be your child's teacher. It is extremely important for the district to be able to gauge accessibility.

To view this update in its entirety, please visit our website at ➡️ https://tinyurl.com/ws4rf4g. #WeRPrexies

post_text:
*** Update Wednesday, March 18, 2020 ***

— MCS buildings will not be open to the public after noon on Thursday, March 19. Anyone needing access to any district building should call prior to arrival between 8:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. This does not apply to those families who are picking up student packets.
— The home paper option packets will be available for pick up at the buildings from 8:00 a.m. until noon tomorrow, March 19. More copies have been made for each grade level.
— If you have a middle school or high school student, please bring your student with you or discuss their class schedule prior to picking up their assignment packet. Please only take packets that apply to your student.

For a full update, please visit ↪️ https://tinyurl.com/qltfsy6. Thank you for working with us as we continue to make positive strides! #WeRPrexies
text:
*** Update Wednesday, March 18, 2020 ***

— MCS buildings will not be open to the public after noon on Thursday, March 19. Anyone needing access to any district building should call prior to arrival between 8:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. This does not apply to those families who are picking up student packets.
— The home paper option packets will be available for pick up at the buildings from 8:00 a.m. until noon tomorrow, March 19. More copies have been made for each grade level.
— If you have a middle school or high school student, please bring your student with you or discuss their class schedule prior to picking up their assignment packet. Please only take packets that apply to your student.

As of today, Thursday, March 12, 2020, the Ohio Department of Health and Governor DeWine has directed all schools to close at the end of the day Monday, March 16 for three weeks. We have decided that there will be 𝗻𝗼 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 for all Marion City Schools students, preschool through twelfth grade, on Monday, March 16, 2020 to allow staff the opportunity to prepare for the three week school closure. The 𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘁 𝗱𝗮𝘆 𝗼𝗳 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 for students will be tomorrow, Friday, March 13.

All information and updates associated with this situation will be posted as they are made available at ➡️ https://tinyurl.com/udwhyna. We invite you to bookmark this page and check back frequently. #WeRPrexies

post_text: The health and safety of all students, staff, and the community are of the utmost importance to us. We would like to take a moment and share with you how Marion City Schools is responding to the subject of Coronavirus (COVID-19). We are working closely with Marion Public Health to monitor the situation and to develop a coordinated and comprehensive public health plan to ensure we are prepared if cases arise in our community. Leaders from Marion Public Health, OhioHealth, and all county school districts will be meeting tomorrow, March 11, to discuss additional organized efforts in greater detail. For more information on preventative measures and links to resources for our families and community, visit ↪️ https://www.marioncityschools.org/student-services/health-services. #WeRPrexies

post_text: ✍️📖 Literacy is an essential element for a student’s education to thrive. That is why MCS has been working diligently over the past year and a half to ensure students continue to work on and improve their literacy skills. We are thrilled to announce that the most recent assessment data shows literacy progress for students in kindergarten through second grade! View ↪️ https://tinyurl.com/sy5rxkd to read more about this exciting achievement. We APPRECIATE the time and effort dedicated by teachers, students, and families for this cause! #WeRPrexies #MCSLiteracy

post_text: 🧪 What better way to celebrate Dr. Seuss Week than by concocting oobleck?! Miss Creasap’s preschool class at George Washington Elementary took this fun idea and even made it into a science lesson! Students explored the concepts of solids, liquids, and forces, because oobleck is BOTH a solid and a liquid depending on how much force is applied to it. The all around 😃s show us just how cool and exciting learning can be! #WeRPrexies #DrSeuss #MCSLearning

post_text: What was on the agenda last week for the Harding High School student council? Leadership training! Mrs. Lawson spoke to members on the topic of “Empowering Staff to Succeed.” Students explored ways to be effective leaders at school, and they gained an understanding of how to make decisions that work to support the student body. It certainly was a productive discussion! 👍👍 #WeRPrexies #MCSLeadership

post_text: 🦅 At Taft Elementary, our fourth grade students’ knowledge of eagles soared to new heights! Last month, special guest Chet Snouffer, who is part of the Eagle Conservation organization in Ohio, gave a fascinating presentation about the flight patterns and nests of eagles throughout Ohio. THANK YOU Mr. Snouffer for taking the time to visit and for wowing our students with many interesting eagle facts! #WeRPrexies #MCSLearning
